question_text: In strengthening controls, which directorate measure matches FR 111?
option_a: The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.
option_b: The Accounting Officer must ensure sound budgeting/accounting systems, internal control, prudent expenditure, accurate revenue collection/accounting, reporting, asset safety, and appearance before PAC.
option_c: The Head of Finance and Accounts must ensure compliance, supervise disbursements and revenue accounting, advise the Accounting Officer, maintain ledgers/records, render returns, manage budget control, train staff, liaise with the Accountant-General, and run an audit-query unit.
option_d: Any directive by a Political Head with financial implications may be in writing; if it causes unauthorized expenditure/contravention, the Accounting Officer is responsible unless they report appropriately (Head of Service/Minister as applicable).
explanation: FR 111 (Accounting Officer) provides that The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.

question_text: As a Director of Finance/Admin, which priority aligns with FR 112?
option_a: The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.
option_b: An Imprest-holder (not a Sub-Accounting Officer) is entrusted with disbursing public money where vouchers cannot be presented immediately and may keep a cash book.
option_c: Any directive by a Political Head with financial implications must be in writing; if it causes unauthorized expenditure/contravention, the Accounting Officer is responsible unless they report appropriately (Head of Service/Minister as applicable).
option_d: The Accounting Officer must ensure sound budgeting/accounting systems, internal control, prudent expenditure, accurate revenue collection/accounting, reporting, asset safety, and appearance before PAC.
explanation: FR 112 (Accounting Officer (functions)) provides that The Accounting Officer must ensure sound budgeting/accounting systems, internal control, prudent expenditure, accurate revenue collection/accounting, reporting, asset safety, and appearance before PAC.

question_text: At directorate level, which control decision is consistent with FR 113?
option_a: The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.
option_b: The Political Head must supervise/control activities, including endorsing annual budget proposals, ensuring implementation of political programmes, and ensuring compliance with rules, regulations and executive policies.
option_c: Accounting Officers must oversee tender board activities, ensure procurement is budgeted/appropriated, set up planning/evaluation/procurement committees, submit returns to BPP, liaise with BPP, and ensure PPA compliance with personal liability for breaches.
option_d: Any directive by a Political Head with financial implications may be in writing; if it causes unauthorized expenditure/contravention, the Accounting Officer is responsible unless they report appropriately (Head of Service/Minister as applicable).
explanation: FR 113 (Accounting Officer (procurement)) provides that Accounting Officers must oversee tender board activities, ensure procurement is budgeted/appropriated, set up planning/evaluation/procurement committees, submit returns to BPP, liaise with BPP, and ensure PPA compliance with personal liability for breaches.

question_text: Which governance measure best translates FR 114 into practice?
option_a: A Sub-Accounting Officer is entrusted with receipt, custody and disbursement of public money and keeps a recognized cash book and prescribed accounts; it includes finance directors/heads of accounts and specified pay/pension officers.
option_b: Any directive by a Political Head with financial implications must be in writing; if it causes unauthorized expenditure/contravention, the Accounting Officer is responsible unless they report appropriately (Head of Service/Minister as applicable).
option_c: The Political Head of a ministry is the Minister; for parastatals/extra-ministerial offices and other agencies, it is the Chairman (or as defined by the enabling law).
option_d: The Head of Finance and Accounts must ensure compliance, supervise disbursements and revenue accounting, advise the Accounting Officer, maintain ledgers/records, render returns, manage budget control, train staff, liaise with the Accountant-General, and run an audit-query unit.
explanation: FR 114 (Head of Finance and Accounts) provides that The Head of Finance and Accounts must ensure compliance, supervise disbursements and revenue accounting, advise the Accounting Officer, maintain ledgers/records, render returns, manage budget control, train staff, liaise with the Accountant-General, and run an audit-query unit.

option_a: Government bank accounts must not be overdrawn and no temporary bank advances may be taken; responsible officers refund bank charges if overdrafts occur.
option_b: Personal money must not enter government accounts and public money must not enter private accounts; paying public money into a private account implies fraudulent intent.
option_c: Signatories are split into A and B categories for signing/countersigning; minimum rank is Accountant I (or equivalent) and same-category signing is forbidden.
option_d: Where an exception permitting cash/cheque use applies, violating that provision attracts sanctions as prescribed by the Financial Regulations.
explanation: FR 710 provides that Government bank accounts must not be overdrawn and no temporary bank advances may be taken; responsible officers refund bank charges if overdrafts occur.

question_text: Which statement is TRUE under FR 711?
option_a: Missions abroad may invest idle funds short-term with prior approval, must classify/remit interest as revenue, keep records, and inform AG/Auditor‑General.
option_b: Capital accounts must be maintained at the Central Bank of Nigeria or other banks designated/authorized by the Accountant‑General.
option_c: No cash or cheque operation may be conducted unless approved by the Minister of Finance on the Accountant‑General’s recommendation.
option_d: Weekly and monthly bank-to-cashbook comparisons are required, with monthly bank statements and signed reconciliation statements submitted with transcripts.
explanation: FR 711 provides that Missions abroad may invest idle funds short-term with prior approval, must classify/remit interest as revenue, keep records, and inform AG/Auditor‑General.

question_text: Under FR 712, what is required?
option_a: Personal money must not enter government accounts and public money must not enter private accounts; paying public money into a private account implies fraudulent intent.
option_b: Official bank accounts require Accountant‑General authorization; only three accounts (Salary, Overhead, Revenue) are permitted unless expressly approved, with periodic returns.
option_c: Payments must not be made for services not yet performed or goods not yet supplied.
option_d: Funding of capital and recurrent accounts follows warrant/AIE processes via Budget Office and Accountant‑General cash backing with proper transfer classifications.
explanation: FR 712 provides that Funding of capital and recurrent accounts follows warrant/AIE processes via Budget Office and Accountant‑General cash backing with proper transfer classifications.

question_text: According to FR 713, which is correct?
option_a: Funding of capital and recurrent accounts follows warrant/AIE processes via Budget Office and Accountant‑General cash backing with proper transfer classifications.

option_c: Personal money must not enter government accounts and public money must not enter private accounts; paying public money into a private account implies fraudulent intent.
option_d: Accounting Officers must provide banks with certified specimen signatures and tightly control notifications of changes; delegation is not allowed.
explanation: FR 713 provides that Personal money must not enter government accounts and public money must not enter private accounts; paying public money into a private account implies fraudulent intent.

question_text: Which provision is stated by FR 714?
option_a: Sub‑Accounting Officers must keep a cheque summary register (maintained by non-cashier staff) and reconcile it daily with cash book and bank balances.

option_d: Missions abroad may invest idle funds short-term with prior approval, must classify/remit interest as revenue, keep records, and inform AG/Auditor‑General.

question_text: Select the option that matches FR 715.

question_text: FR 111 describes duties or meaning for which post?
option_a: Any directive by a Political Head with financial implications must be in writing; if it causes unauthorized expenditure/contravention, the Accounting Officer is responsible unless they report appropriately (Head of Service/Minister as applicable).
option_b: The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.
option_c: The Political Head of a ministry is the Minister; for parastatals/extra-ministerial offices and other agencies, it is the Chairman (or as defined by the enabling law).
option_d: The Head of Finance and Accounts must ensure compliance, supervise disbursements and revenue accounting, advise the Accounting Officer, maintain ledgers/records, render returns, manage budget control, train staff, liaise with the Accountant-General, and run an audit-query unit.
explanation: FR 111 (Accounting Officer) provides that The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.

question_text: Which role is explicitly described in FR 112?
option_a: The Head of Finance and Accounts may ensure compliance, supervise disbursements and revenue accounting, advise the Accounting Officer, maintain ledgers/records, render returns, manage budget control, train staff, liaise with the Accountant-General, and run an audit-query unit.
option_b: The Accounting Officer must ensure sound budgeting/accounting systems, internal control, prudent expenditure, accurate revenue collection/accounting, reporting, asset safety, and appearance before PAC.
option_c: A Sub-Accounting Officer is entrusted with receipt, custody and disbursement of public money and keeps a recognized cash book and prescribed accounts; it includes finance directors/heads of accounts and specified pay/pension officers.
option_d: The Political Head of a ministry is the Minister; for parastatals/extra-ministerial offices and other agencies, it is the Chairman (or as defined by the enabling law).
explanation: FR 112 (Accounting Officer (functions)) provides that The Accounting Officer must ensure sound budgeting/accounting systems, internal control, prudent expenditure, accurate revenue collection/accounting, reporting, asset safety, and appearance before PAC.

question_text: FR 113 clarifies the identity of which role in government finance?
option_a: Accounting Officers must oversee tender board activities, ensure procurement is budgeted/appropriated, set up planning/evaluation/procurement committees, submit returns to BPP, liaise with BPP, and ensure PPA compliance with personal liability for breaches.
option_b: The Head of Finance and Accounts must ensure compliance, supervise disbursements and revenue accounting, advise the Accounting Officer, maintain ledgers/records, render returns, manage budget control, train staff, liaise with the Accountant-General, and run an audit-query unit.
option_c: A Sub-Accounting Officer is entrusted with receipt, custody and disbursement of public money and keeps a recognized cash book and prescribed accounts; it includes finance directors/heads of accounts and specified pay/pension officers.
option_d: A Revenue Collector (not a Sub-Accounting Officer) is entrusted with official receipt/licence/ticket booklets for regular collection of particular revenue and must keep a cash book.
explanation: FR 113 (Accounting Officer (procurement)) provides that Accounting Officers must oversee tender board activities, ensure procurement is budgeted/appropriated, set up planning/evaluation/procurement committees, submit returns to BPP, liaise with BPP, and ensure PPA compliance with personal liability for breaches.

question_text: A senior officer reviews compliance. Which requirement comes from FR 111?

option_b: The Political Head may supervise/control activities, including endorsing annual budget proposals, ensuring implementation of political programmes, and ensuring compliance with rules, regulations and executive policies.
option_c: The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.
option_d: The Accounting Officer must ensure sound budgeting/accounting systems, internal control, prudent expenditure, accurate revenue collection/accounting, reporting, asset safety, and appearance before PAC.
explanation: FR 111 (Accounting Officer) provides that The Accounting Officer is the Permanent Secretary or head of an entity who controls and is responsible for human, material and financial resources.

question_text: Which governance obligation is stated in FR 112?

question_text: From a system-wide governance perspective, FR 111 mainly protects what?
